$options)
Allows you to edit the specified form information.

$name,
$options)
Allows you to edit the field on the specified form.
private $email
Contains the members email address.
public function email_allowed($member_email,  
$member_id =  0)
Checks to see if the specified email is allowed (either the whole address itself, or the domain) and not already taken.
abstract public function errno()
Returns the error number of which occurred from the last database method called, if any.
protected $errno
The error number which occurred during the processing of the query.
abstract public function error()
Returns the error string from the last SELECT, UPDATE, INSERT, etc.
protected $error
The error string from the error which occurred during the processing of the query.
abstract public function escape($str,  
$htmlspecialchars =  false)
Makes a string safe to use in a query.
public function exists($name)
abstract public function fetch_array()
Fetches the results array (Both numeric and associative indexes) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function fetch_assoc()
Fetches the results array (associative indexes only) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function fetch_object()
A lot like fetch_assoc, however, an object (stdClass) is returned instead of an array.
abstract public function fetch_row()
Fetches the results array (numeric indexes only) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function field_name($field_offset)
Fetches the name of the field corresponding to the field offset.
public function field_registered($form_name,
$name)
Checks to see if the supplied field is registered on the specified form.
public function filter_registered($filter_name,
$callback)
Checks to see if the supplied callback is already registered with the filter name.
private $filters
Holds registered filter callbacks...
Filters are much like hooks, except these simply allow you to make minor and much simpler changes to the system, by allowing you to change a value, such as a URL, page name, and so on.
abstract public function footer()
This is a method which the Implemented_Theme class must implement! 
This is a very useful tool which aids in the creation, and saving, of form information.

private $groups
Registered groups, permission hook, in other words.
private $groups
Contains an array of groups the member is assigned to.
private $hash
A set of random characters (up to 16 characters) that the members authentication cookie is salted with.
abstract public function header()
This is a method which the Implemented_Theme class must implement! 
public function hook_registered($hook_name,
$callback)
Allows you to check if a callback is already registered in the specified hook name.
private $hooked
An array containing callbacks that have hooked themselves through the API...
private $hooked_actions
Another array containing actions plugins have registered (allows ?action=REGISTERED_ACTION)
private $hooked_subactions
Yup, thats right, an array containing sub-actions plugins can register on actions Please note that sub-actions only work if the plugin that registered the action uses this sub-action API
Here is a simple list of hook names and where they are located, soon there will be a more in depth updating of this list, such as including the parameters that are passed by these hooks, if any.
function htmlchars($str)
Encodes the supplied string with htmlspecialchars with ENT_QUOTES and UTF-8 as parameters.
function htmlchars_decode($str)
Decodes the supplied string with htmlspecialchars_decode with ENT_QUOTES as parameters.
The HTTP class allows you to access remote files on the Internet.
function http_curl_request($request)
This function completes the specified remote request using the PHP extension cURL.
function http_fsockopen_request($request,  
$num_redirects =  0)
This function completes the specified remote request using fsockopen.L.
private $http_version
The HTTP version to use in requests, either 1.0 or 1.1
private $id
Contains the members ID.
private $include_header
Whether or not you want to have the header included with the body of the retrieved file.
protected function init()
This is a protected method, which can be overloaded by the Implemented_Theme class, which can be used to add any required CSS, JavaScript, or what-have-you without hardcoding it :)
function init_core()
Registers actions which are default “features”, such as logging in/out, registration, and other such operations.
function init_func()
init_func initializes the the $func array which contains variable functions for handling strings to allow better language support.

function init_settings()

function init_theme()
Creates the $theme object.

$keys =  array(),
$hook_name =  null)
